name: Maximal rank conjecture
rephrased: For a general curve of genus g, the expected dimension of the space of sections of the canonical bundle is achieved, meaning the map from the space of global sections to the space of sections has maximal rank.
implication_form: If a curve is general of genus g, then the map from H^0(K_C) to H^0(L_C) has maximal rank (i.e., its dimension equals its rank).
explained: The Maximal Rank Conjecture is a foundational conjecture in algebraic geometry and enumerative geometry. It concerns the dimension of the moduli space of curves (more precisely, stable maps) in a smooth projective variety (like a complex projective variety) that satisfy certain incidence conditions. The conjecture predicts that for a general curve (or a general stable map from a curve) and a general target variety, the expected dimension of the space of such curves (or maps) passing through a given set of points (or more generally, satisfying given conditions) is equal to the maximal possible rank of the relevant cohomology groups (or obstruction theories) involved. In simpler terms, it posits that the enumerative geometry of curves in a variety behaves in its 'largest possible' dimension, without unexpected obstructions reducing the dimension further than anticipated by standard intersection theory calculations.
related_conjectures: Conjectures regarding the Kodaira dimension of moduli spaces
